title: Tiberias
summary: Tiberias (/taɪˈbɪəriəs/ ty-BEER-ee-əs; Hebrew: טְבֶרְיָה‎, Ṭəḇeryā; Arabic: طبريا‎, romanized: Ṭabariyyā) is an Israeli city on the western shore of the Sea of Galilee. Established around 20 CE, it was named in honour of the second emperor of the Roman Empire, Tiberius.[3] In 2019 it had a population of 44,779.[2]
